description: 1854 pre-iotized, 1874 iotization, iotized, 1890 iotised, 1906 iotise. Adapted from Ancient Greek ἰωτίζω (iōtízō, “I write with an iota”). Compare iota.

verbs.description: iotize (third-person singular simple present iotizes, present participle iotizing, simple past and past participle iotized) (transitive)

entries.meaning: (linguistics) To precede a spoken vowel sound with a "y" sound, as the u in "pure" and "cute".
